Levels.AchievementText: Win with your Hero's HP at 80% or above.
Win with your Hero's HP at 90% or above.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Wolfswood. I'd usually suggest we go around it . . .
Usually, we would be going around the Myst Valley . . .
True. It's too dangerous to walk around. It would mean an almost certain confrontation with the Scarlet Nation.
Does anyone else find it odd that we're in Wolfswood and have yet to see a single wolf?
You are not a very keen observer. There was a wolf following us earlier.
He must have known he would have no chance against us.
It's more likely the wolf went to alert the rest of his pack.
Captain, are those the Lostlorn Woods up ahead?
Yes. Everyone stay alert. This forest wasn't named the Lostlorn Woods for nothing.
I feel like we were just here . . . Doesn't that tree look eerily familiar?
. . . Have we just been walking in circles?
No, they just look similar. I've been marking the trees as we go, and this tree has no markings.
Thank god . . .
There is nothing I hate more than these wet, cold marshes.
Stop your complaining and get a move on.
Aahh . . . I think I've stepped in a trap. I can't move my foot!
Stop flailing! You're just going to make it worse.
. . . and you've attracted the attention of those giant spiders over there.

Levels.AchievementText: Have fewer than 3 cards in the cemetery.

Dialogue.Dialogue: These spider webs seem to get thicker with each step I take.
I suppose that means we've entered Spiderwood.
I hate spiders!
I don't. Especially after they've been roasted over a fire. Tastes like chicken.
There's a big spider over there. Maybe you can cook us dinner tonight. Heheh.

Levels.AchievementText: Win with your Hero's HP at 90% or above.

Dialogue.Dialogue: I never thought it'd be so easy to get past that camp.
Yeah . . . the guards seemed far too relaxed.
Don't speak so soon, humans!
Where did you come from?!
These green-skinned goblins really blend in with the grass . . .
Ha! Stupid humans. Feel the wrath of the goblins!

Levels.AchievementText: Win with your Hero's HP at 90% or above.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Oh my! What is that awful smell?
It's the Evernight River.
The water is extremely acidic. Whatever you do, do not go in the water!
Is the air acidic as well? I think I'm going to be sick.
Don't worry. The smell is awful, but it won't harm you.
You'll get used to it.

Levels.AchievementText: Use at least 2 Tundra cards in your Deck.
Win with your Hero's HP at 90% or above.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Look! There's a goblin camp up ahead.
Think of a way around them. We don't have time to waste fighting goblins.
There's a small road to the east. It appears to only be guarded by a single goblin.
I'll go get his attention while you guys sneak behind him and take him out.
Consider it done.

Levels.AchievementText: At least 3 2-star cards in the Deck

Dialogue.Dialogue: There's a lake over there. Wait for me . . . I'm going to get us some water.
Be careful. There are man-eating fish in that lake.
And it's not just the fish you should be worried about either.
. . . I think I've been spotted.
We're almost at the Titian Fog Bridge.
Who could mistake that thick fog?
I think someone is waiting for us on the bridge . . .
Who dares to come here?
*whispers* Don't answer. Ready, set . . . charge!
Idiots. You'll never pass through here.

Levels.AchievementText: Use at least 2 Forest cards in your Deck
Have fewer than 3 cards in the cemetery.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Finally out of the Myst Valley. What's next?
The Goshawk Pass will take us to Goshawk Fortress. We should be able to get some rest there.
The Scarlet Nation isn't there yet, right?
I don't think so. If they'd already started a war over here, we would have seen them by now.

Levels.AchievementText: Win with your Hero's HP at 70% or above.
Have fewer than 4 cards in the cemetery.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Stop! What's the purpose of your visit to Whitewing?
We're scouts sent from Ebon Hold. We must pass through here.
Do you have a token?
Right here.
You're free to enter, but be careful. There have been some . . . odd happenings as of late.

Levels.AchievementText: At least 3 2-star cards in the Deck
Win with your Hero's HP at 80% or above.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Pass, please.
Here. *shows token*
Ah . . . continue on then.
Something feels off about this place.
Yeah. The guards certainly don't seem very friendly.
Let's just get in, find some supplies, and get out.

Levels.AchievementText: Have fewer than 4 cards in the cemetery.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Captain . . . we're being followed.
I noticed. They followed us through the whole city.
There is an abandoned mine up ahead. Maybe we can lose them there.
Let's go.

Levels.AchievementText: Win with your Hero's HP at 70% or above.
At least 2 1-star cards in the Deck

Dialogue.Dialogue: So naive. You really thought you could lose us so easily?
I already hate these guys.
They look like a group of hunters . . .
Haha, good eye.
We haven't done anything wrong. Why are you following us?
Don't play stupid. We know where you're going.
What are you? The Scarlet Nation's lapdogs?
Haha . . .

Levels.AchievementText: At least 2 3-star cards in the Deck
Win with your Hero's HP at 80% or above.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Is everyone alright?
I'm fine, Captain. Where did those hunters come from?
They are the Duke of Goshawk's private troops . . . Goshawk Tower must have defected.
The Alliance is going to be attacked from all sides. Do you think those bandits will try to hunt us down again?
Yes. Aisha and I are going to draw their attention. You make a run for Boulder Town and pass on our message. We'll meet back at Onyx River.
Alright, then we'll split up here. Be safe.

Levels.AchievementText: Have fewer than 2 cards in the cemetery.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Do you think Wolfe will make it to Onyx River on time?
Yes.
What if he's not there?
We'll wait another day. If he's still not there . . . we'll have to start without him.
Captain, there's a soldier catching up to us. Let's take him out.

Levels.AchievementText: Have fewer than 4 cards in the cemetery.

Dialogue.Dialogue: We've already waited too long. Start packing up. We cannot afford to wait any longer.
Captain! Look over there! Isn't that him?
You're right! He made it!
Wait . . . Who are those people behind him?
Heheh. Let's go check it out.

Levels.AchievementText: Have fewer than 5 cards in the cemetery.
Win with your Hero's HP at 80% or above.
At least 2 2-star cards in the Deck

Dialogue.Dialogue: Humans, do not attempt to go any further.
Have we arrived at the Forest Kingdom?
Yes.
Fantastic! We made it.
We come from the Northern Alliance. This is our token. We wish to speak to your council.
Follow me.

Levels.AchievementText: Use at least 3 Forest cards in your Deck
Have fewer than 4 cards in the cemetery.

Dialogue.Dialogue: These elves sure don't seem very friendly.
I'm pretty sure they don't like us.
We are a group of uninvited strangers disrupting their lives. What is there to like?
Let's just hope their council doesn't feel the same way.
We'll just have to wait and see.

Levels.AchievementText: At least 2 3-star cards in the Deck

Dialogue.Dialogue: Finally reached the shore. Are you guys alright?
Not bad. I never thought the rapids would be so strong here . . .
Let's split up and take a look around. Be careful.

Levels.AchievementText: Use at least 2 Tundra cards in your Deck.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Captain, come here quick! We have a possible situation on our hands!
What's wrong?
There are some elves over there. We must be getting close to the Forest Kingdom.
They spotted us . . . they don't look very friendly, either.
Northerners, please state your reason for disrupting the Forest Kingdom.
Noble Council. We are here to humbly request the help of the Forest Kingdom in the war at Ebon Hold.
The Black Swamp Tribe is evil, but they've never threatened war before. I don't understand . . .
Me neither. However, I fear they will not stop until they've destroyed us all.
Fear not, the Forest Kingdom will join the Northern Alliance.

Levels.AchievementText: Use at least 3 Mountain cards in your deck

Dialogue.Dialogue: Leanda, take this letter and these men to Quill City. You have three days to rally all of the warriors you can find. Meet us at Stony Bay.
My honor, Lord.
Take the shortcut through Valehall.
Valehall?
Yes, there is a portal that connects Quill City to Hornvale.

Levels.AchievementText: Win with your Hero's HP at 70% or above.

Dialogue.Dialogue: This doesn't look like Quill . . .
. . . It's possible that a magic tide has interfered with the teleportation.
Does this happen often?
No, only twice in the last hundred years.
Alright. First things first, we need to figure out where we are.

Levels.AchievementText: Have fewer than 5 cards in the cemetery.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Even with the interference, it shouldn't have teleported us too far away.
Judging by our surroundings, I'd say we are somewhere near the Red Wastelands.
Well then, let's get moving back to Hornvale.
We wouldn't be far from the city, if there weren't a mountain range in the way.

Levels.AchievementText: Have fewer than 3 cards in the cemetery.

Dialogue.Dialogue: How long will it take us to get around this mountain range?
On foot . . . the war would be over by the time we got back.
Then what should we do?
Walk east. There is a griffon den on the volcano over there. We can try taming one and riding it to the city.

Levels.AchievementText: At least 2 2-star cards in the Deck

Dialogue.Dialogue: Captain, come look.
A battle took place here recently.
Let me take a look . . . I'd say it happened less than three days ago.
There are bloodstains leading that way. Should we go check it out?
. . . forget it. We can't get distracted now.

Levels.AchievementText: Use at least 3 Tundra cards in your Deck
Have fewer than 3 cards in the cemetery.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Stop.
What's wrong?
Look at the ground. There is a magic seal here.
This seal has been broken . . .
Offer yourselves.

Levels.AchievementText: Win with your Hero's HP at 60% or above.

Dialogue.Dialogue: There is no way such a powerful seal was used to hold in one Headless Horseman.
He's just a remnant of the dark magic they used to break this seal.
We're just lucky we didn't run into whatever was sealed here . . .
True . . . though we are following right in its footsteps.
How do you know?
We have been walking in a trail of dead plants. This is a new trail, not an old path . . .

Levels.AchievementText: Use at least 4 Mountain cards in your deck

Dialogue.Dialogue: Gua! Gua!
These griffons are huge!
Leanda, how do we go about taming these creatures?
Let me give it a try . . .
Gua! Gua!
Sure doesn't look easy . . .
I bet they would listen to my fists . . .

Levels.AchievementText: At least 1 1-star cards in the Deck

Dialogue.Dialogue: These stupid griffons don't seem very reliable.
Hold on tight and stop flailing around. We're right above a volcano.
Wah! A fireball just flew past my head. Is the Volcano about to erupt?
No . . . there is a fire mage attacking us from down below!
We've been hit! Hold on tight . . . we're going down for a crash landing!

Levels.AchievementText: Use at least 3 Forest cards in your Deck

Dialogue.Dialogue: Whoa! What a rush! I can't believe we made it out of that alive!
Aisha, get out of the water! That spring doesn't look safe.
Too late . . . She's already been poisoned.
What?
If you want to save your friend, you'd best follow me. Hurry, she doesn't have much time!

Levels.AchievementText: Have fewer than 5 cards in the cemetery.

Dialogue.Dialogue: This place feels so strange. Are we in the lands of Black Swamp?
Heheh. Good guess. We're very close.
Then you must be a Black Swamp mage?
Indeed. Caldrin is my name. Will that be a problem?
No, no, no . . . I just . . . You look a little different . . . but not evil or anything . . .
Heh. Very well then.

Levels.AchievementText: Use an Air rune in your deck.
Have fewer than 5 cards in the cemetery.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Up ahead is my old home. I should have some medicine inside.
If this is your old home, where do you live now?
Currently . . . well, I've recently been chased out. I was on my way back here.
We just came from the Red Wastelands and saw some ruins there. Was that your place?
There used to be a seal locking in a demon. I had built a test center there to study the seal.
The Scarlet Nation came when I wasn't around and broke the seal, releasing the demon back into the world.
Your Black Swamp Tribe is an ally to the Scarlet Nation.
Not every Black Swamp mage is part of the Tribe. Even within the Tribe not all members agree with that decision.

Levels.AchievementText: At least 2 2-star cards in the Deck

Dialogue.Dialogue: How long before her health returns?
I gave her an antidote. It will help her immune system fight off the poison, but it may still take a while.
Although . . . if you were able to find a scale from a Flame Serpent, we would be able to revive her much more quickly.
Where can we find a Flame Serpent?
A Flame Serpent has made a nest inside of the Hall of Indecision, just west of here.
Will you be coming with us?
I'm sorry. I have much work to do.
Earlier you said there are many in the Black Swamp Tribe who do not support the war. What did you mean?
It's true. Many have left, others have joined the army, but . . . If you find Archmage Loken of the Secret Onyx Society . . .
Archmage Loken?
Yes, if you could convince him to appear, who knows what would happen.

Levels.AchievementText: Use a Water rune in your deck.
Use at least 3 Forest cards in your Deck

Dialogue.Dialogue: This appears to be a temple . . . but it's really odd.
Black Swamp architecture . . . I'm willing to bet it doesn't just LOOK odd either . . .
. . . look at our shadows.
Is something wrong with my eyes, or . . . are our shadows dancing?
Quick, light a fire! Make the shadows disappear.

Levels.AchievementText: Use at least 3 Swamp cards in your deck

Dialogue.Dialogue: Captain! While we were watching our shadows, Aisha . . . disappeared?
Curses! She wasn't taken by her shadow, was she?
Don't worry, we will find her . . . follow me.
This feels like a maze . . . Are you sure this is where she'll be?
I've been following footprints on the floor.
We have no other choice. Just be careful and stick together.

Levels.AchievementText: Use a Fire rune in your deck.
Use at least 3 Forest cards in your Deck

Dialogue.Dialogue: Wolfe, watch out!
Ssss . . .
This . . . a Flame Serpent? We found the Hall of Indecision . . .
. . . too bad we lost Aisha . . .
Running into a Flame Serpent here is a good omen. Let's take him out now while we have the chance.

Levels.AchievementText: At least 2 2-star cards in the Deck

Dialogue.Dialogue: Aisha should be just up ahead.
It appears to be an altar of sorts . . .
Is that Aisha lying on the altar?! Quick, get her down from there!
Congratulations! You tracked me down. Unfortunately, your efforts were all in vain. Heheheh.
You're a fool to believe we'd give up now.

Levels.AchievementText: Use an Earth rune in your deck.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Quick, pick up Aisha. I'll give her the medicine.
If what that mage said was true, Aisha should be back to full health soon.
Yes. Let's just hope he wasn't lying to us.
Come up here.
What?!
Come to the top of Twisted Tower, and you'll find a way to take the Swamp Tribe out of the war.
Are you . . . Archmage Loken?

Levels.AchievementText: Have fewer than 4 cards in the cemetery.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Do you think this staff will be enough to convince the Black Swamp Tribe to pull out of the war?
It was the only thing at the top of the tower. If that was Archmage Loken, this must be good for something.
How do you think we use it?
Aisha, you're awake!
I've been conscious the whole time, I just wasn't able to move.
We're just happy you're okay. Let's take this staff back. Maybe somebody else will know what to do with it.

Levels.AchievementText: Use an Earth rune in your deck.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Captain, I've scouted the area. There seems to be a large number of refugees.
Refugees? Why would there be refugees here?
Armies from all four nations have been seen marching around here. Locals fear war is about to break out.
If they've seen all four nations . . . that must mean the elves have joined the battle.
Let's get over there and join them!

Levels.AchievementText: Use at least 4 Tundra cards in your Deck

Dialogue.Dialogue: General, it's good to see you!
How'd you guys get here? The Forest Kingdom informed us that you had a problem while teleporting.
A small detour. We spoke to Archmage Loken and he gave us this staff. Said it will pull the Swamp Tribe out of the war . . .
What?! Wait, wait, wait . . . Is the staff glowing?
Ahh, it's trying to fly away! I can barely hold on to it!
Swamp Tribe . . . If you have not forgotten your pledge to the Yggdrasil Staff . . . Go back . . . This battlefield is no place for you . . .
The staff . . . vanished . . . wait, is the Swamp Tribe leaving?
Excellent! The Scarlet Nation is doomed now! Men, let's strike while we can!

Levels.AchievementText: Use a Fire rune in your deck.

Dialogue.Dialogue: I never thought that staff would be so effective! They actually left! But what is this Yggdrasil oath?
I've never heard of it before. I guess if we run into Loken or another Black Swamp mage, we could ask.
Without the Black Swamp Tribe's magic, the Scarlet Nation is nothing.
If we can take out Annabon Fortress, we'll be able to send troops right into the heart of the Scarlet Nation.

Levels.AchievementText: Use at least 4 Forest cards in your Deck

Dialogue.Dialogue: We've had the Scarlet Nation surrounded for so long, but they just won't quit.
They'll run out of food and supplies soon. They won't be able to keep this up much longer.
General, a messenger delivered this letter. I think you should take a look at it.
Hand it over . . . Prince Lionheart has requested to meet us at the Fertile Plains.
Sounds like they are ready to surrender!
I'm afraid it won't be that simple. Lionheart is only a prince. His influence in the Scarlet Nation is limited.
Well, we must at least go see what he wants. Come with me.
Yes, sir!

Levels.AchievementText: Use a Water rune in your deck.
Use at least 4 Mountain cards in your deck

Dialogue.Dialogue: Prince, your majesty, it's been a long time. I never thought we would be meeting on here on a battlefield.
General, to be meeting you here was never my intention.
Your majesty, about this war . . . there is one thing I just don't understand . . .
I already know what you're going to say. You see . . . a while back a Black Swamp mage came to us to propose an alliance.
He claimed our two nations would conquer the world together, and my brother would be given the Forest Kingdom.
So he was taken by greed . . . Why have you brought us here?
I've taken my army out of the plains to give you access to the Scarlet Nation. All I ask is that you don't harm my citizens.
That is very noble of you, young prince. We must put an end to this war quickly.

Levels.AchievementText: Have fewer than 5 cards in the cemetery.
Win with your Hero's HP at 60% or above.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Our army has already retreated. March through the Shortsword Canyon and you will arrive at Greywolf City.
Thank you, young prince. History books will speak of your wisdom and praise your efforts to end this war.
I'm sorry I couldn't do more. I lead only my own men . . . I have no control over the rest of the army.
Our warriors are only taking orders. Please understand that, and spare them whenever possible.
Your majesty, I take no pleasure in taking another man's life, this you can be sure of.
That is all I can ask of you. I hope the next time we meet, our great lands will once again be living in peace.

Levels.AchievementText: Use an Air rune in your deck.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Well, that was quite a turn of events. I never imagined we'd be attacking the Scarlet Nation so soon . . .
Indeed . . . This sudden change of heart by the prince has left me a feeling a little skeptical . . .
Captain, don't think too much. Let's just get in there and end this war!
I'm with Aisha on this one. We have a means to end this, we must act on it now.
Exactly. I can already envision all of the medals we'll be decorated with after we end this war! Haha!
General, we are about to arrive at the Shortsword Canyon.
Can you tell me the layout of the land.
The mouth of the canyon is small. I fear we may be ambushed there.
Everyone be alert. The prince's army has retreated, but they are not the entire Scarlet Nation.
Yes, sir.

Levels.AchievementText: Use an Air rune in your deck.
At least 3 2-star cards in the Deck

Dialogue.Dialogue: Blackhaven is truly magnificent.
I just want to get my hands on that godforsaken Emperor!
Captain, you look like you're contemplating something.
I can't figure out why that Black Swamp mage that Prince Lionheart mentioned has yet to appear . . .
I guess he was also summoned back to the Black Swamp by the staff earlier.
No . . . the others may have been, but not him.
There's only one way to find out, and it starts with taking this city!

Levels.AchievementText: At least 1 2-star cards in the Deck
At least 1 1-star cards in the Deck

Dialogue.Dialogue: I completely forgot about Redmoon Lake . . .
They've burned all of the boats. How are we supposed to get across?
We'll never catch them if we have to walk around the lake . . .
We'll have to find some wood to build some small rafts.
There's nothing else we can do. Be careful, this lake is home to some fierce water creatures . . .

Levels.AchievementText: Use at least 5 Mountain cards in your deck

Dialogue.Dialogue: Something doesn't feel right about this. Greywolf City shouldn't be so quiet . . .
General, my men have scouted up ahead. It appears as if the city has been prepared for an ambush.
Indeed, the signs are clear. They've been waiting for us for a day or two.
Haha, amateurs. Well then, let's head to the forest and take them out first, and then we can take Greywolf City.

Levels.AchievementText: Use at least 5 Mountain cards in your deck

Dialogue.Dialogue: I don't think they will be dumb enough to try that again.
We certainly took care of Greywolf City quickly enough. I don't think Hellholt will put up much of a fight.
I bet we can just march right into the city.
Men, start preparing. We'll attack soon!

Levels.AchievementText: At least 3 4-star cards in the Deck
Use at least 5 Tundra cards in your Deck

Dialogue.Dialogue: We will soon be arriving at the Serpentscale Pass . . .
It's said no one has ever succeeded in taking Serpentscale . . .
Well, nothing lasts forever, right?
We must be ready for this battle. This will be our biggest test yet.

Levels.AchievementText: At least 1 2-star cards in the Deck
Use at least 5 Swamp cards in your deck

Dialogue.Dialogue: These gates are the only thing keeping us from storming Blackhaven.
General, I can't find these gates on our map . . .
True. These gates are very new.
If these gates are new, then they have never been tested. Maybe we'll be able to find a weakness in them.
We can only hope . . .

Levels.AchievementText: Use at least 5 Swamp cards in your deck

Dialogue.Dialogue: General, we've searched the entire palace, the Emperor is nowhere to be found.
Curses! He must have known we were coming!
General, a prisoner spoke. He said the Emperor left towards the Rising Sun Plateau.
Let me check the map . . . He is headed for the Scarlet Volcano. The summer palace there is still well protected.
General, let us go ahead and try to catch them before they arrive!
Okay. You'll have to leave right away.
It's so hot . . .
Yeah, I have no idea why an Emperor would live in a place like this.
The Rising Sun Plateau is home to only a small number of wild animals, and almost no humans.
Captain, we've spotted some cavalry up ahead. They appear to be Scarlet Nation. Should we go around them?
We don't have time, and they've most likely seen us. Men, prepare for battle!

Levels.AchievementText: At least 2 2-star cards in the Deck
Have fewer than 5 cards in the cemetery.

Dialogue.Dialogue: That's the Scarlet Volcano up ahead.
It's too bad we weren't able to catch the Emperor earlier . . .
If it weren't for Redmoon Lake, we would have had a chance.
I suppose we'll just have to wait for the rest of our army to catch up before we attack.

Levels.AchievementText: Use at least 5 Forest cards in your Deck

Dialogue.Dialogue: I'm impressed you've made it this far, General.
I'm sure you never expected it to end like this, Emperor!
Be careful, General. You haven't won the battle yet.
This is your last chance to surrender, Emperor. Give up now, and live to see another day!
How dare you insult me! Do you honestly believe you'll win this battle?!

Levels.AchievementText: At least 2 2-star cards in the Deck
Have fewer than 5 cards in the cemetery.

Dialogue.Dialogue: This here is the Magic Consulate. It also harbors the Augur Academy's library.
I bet they have some cool magic books inside. Can we go take a look?
Don't even think about it. It's sure to be heavily guarded, and they wouldn't let the likes of you in.
Yeah, besides . . . you wouldn't be able to read the books anyway.
Why not?
If you have never studied magical script, the books will be illegible. They may even cause irreparable damage . . .
Was that really Archmage Loken's voice?
I think so, but he could use a lesson in proper communication . . .
Forget it. Let's just go check out the islands.
Should we trust him? We don't even know who he is!
Well, he didn't let us down last time . . .

Levels.AchievementText: At least 3 3-star cards in the Deck
Use an Earth rune in your deck.

Dialogue.Dialogue: We did it!
The General is going to meet with the Northern Council and Prince Lionheart. We are free to go home.
Captain, is something bothering you? You don't seem very excited to be going home.
It's just . . . I can't understand what happened to that mage . . .
You worry too much. It's over. We can go home!

Levels.AchievementText: Use a Water rune in your deck.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Captain, the Emperor said the mage disappeared shortly before the staff summoned the tribe back.
That seems odd. How did he know they would be summoned back?
Or could he sense the Scarlet Nation was doomed to lose this war?
They say he came from the Black Swamp's Augur Academy . . .
I want to take a quick detour and check out the academy. Anyone who wishes to join me is welcome.
Fine . . .

Levels.AchievementText: Use at least 5 Mountain cards in your deck
At least 3 4-star cards in the Deck

Dialogue.Dialogue: If we're going to the academy, we should head out west and go through the Formless Door.
Formless Door? Is it invisible?
Yes. It is maintained through ancient magic. Very mysterious . . .
If we can't see it . . . how do you expect us to find it?
The outline is visible during a full moon.
The next full moon will be out soon! We'll only have to wait a couple of days.

Levels.AchievementText: Use at least 5 Tundra cards in your Deck

Dialogue.Dialogue: Is that the Formless Door? I can't see anything behind it.
The Formless Door is an ancient form of black magic. It distorts time and space.
I've always heard that Augur Academy is very closed off from the rest of the world . . .
Is this door the only way to access the academy?
No, this is more like the back door. The main entrance is next to the Endless Sea.

Levels.AchievementText: At least 2 3-star cards in the Deck

Dialogue.Dialogue: Whoa! Is that what it feels like to distort time? That was amazing!
Heheh. Augur Academy has long been the Black Swamp's oldest and most mysterious area.
Be careful, we are entering uninvited. This place is more dangerous than anywhere we've been so far.
What exactly are we doing here?
We are looking for the Seven Gods Palace. We should find an archmage there who can answer our questions.
Captain, how do you know he's going to help us?
From my experience, they are not as difficult to talk to as one would think.

Levels.AchievementText: Use a Water rune in your deck.

Dialogue.Dialogue: This must be the Seven Gods Palace.
I don't understand. The Swamp Tribe doesn't believe in gods.
The seven gods here are not gods like our own. They are the seven great mages.
That voice . . . Are you Archmage Loken?
The person you are looking for is on the Rune Islands.

Levels.AchievementText: Use an Air rune in your deck.

Dialogue.Dialogue: This place reeks of murder, but I don't see anyone around here.
This is where they execute people . . .
In ancient times, people would be forced to fight to the death right here. Prolonged exposure to this smell will make you start to see illusions.
Ah . . . those preying mantises . . . Are they just an illusion?
Sssshhh . . .
That's no illusion!

Levels.AchievementText: Use at least 4 Forest cards in your Deck
At least 1 1-star cards in the Deck

Dialogue.Dialogue: I think we've come the wrong way . . . there's a giant cliff up ahead.
Don't worry. You see that Ice Dragon? We can ride him across the sea to the islands.
You do realize you're talking about a dragon, right?
Just trust me.
Rrroar!

Levels.AchievementText: Use a Fire rune in your deck.
At least 2 4-star cards in the Deck

Dialogue.Dialogue: There is so much smoke coming up from this island. I can't see anything.
It's Latite Island, home to most of the Rune Islands' active volcanoes.
Should we go down and take a look?
We won't see anything from here, and it is possible he is using this smoke as a cover.

Levels.AchievementText: At least 2 3-star cards in the Deck
Use at least 5 Forest cards in your Deck

Dialogue.Dialogue: Captain, I didn't see anything out of the ordinary.
Me neither.
Where's Wolfe? Why hasn't he come back yet?
I hope nothing has happened to him . . . What if he didn't have time to send a signal?
He went this way. Let's go look for him.

Levels.AchievementText: Use an Earth rune in your deck.
At least 3 3-star cards in the Deck

Dialogue.Dialogue: This is your home. Where are you going to run away to now?
What makes you think I'm going to run? You're going to wish you didn't enter my fortress without preparing for it!
Who says we didn't prepare. We know all of your tricks, there is nothing left for us to do but take you down!
"They always saw the bright side of everything." That's what I'll engrave on your tombs after I'm done with you. Hahahaha!

Levels.AchievementText: Use an Earth rune in your deck.
Have fewer than 5 cards in the cemetery.

Dialogue.Dialogue: These must be the Rune Islands, right?
Judging by this map, this should be . . . Meteor Isle.
Ancient folklore says this was a meteor that fell from the sky and landed here, forming this island.
Really?! But it's so huge!
That can't be true . . . If this fell from the sky, it would be a giant pit, not an island!

Levels.AchievementText: Use at least 5 Mountain cards in your deck
At least 3 3-star cards in the Deck

Dialogue.Dialogue: Captain, there are so many islands. How are we supposed to know where to look?
Even if we don't count the small islands, there are still at least ten islands that he could be on.
Let's fly above and look. We'll go down and search any islands that show signs of habitation.
These islands are still dangerous. What if we attract unwanted attention?
With all we've been through, I think we can handle ourselves.

Levels.AchievementText: Use at least 6 Swamp cards in your deck
Use a Fire rune in your deck.

Dialogue.Dialogue: We've been searching for so long, and still have nothing to show for it.
There are still plenty of islands. No sense getting worked up about it just yet.
Captain, come look over here.
This could only have been done by a human.
These are very rare fire leaves used in black magic. If you look closely, only the oldest and most powerful are missing . . .
Let's split up and search the island. If you see anything, send a signal.

Levels.AchievementText: Use a Water rune in your deck.
Have fewer than 5 cards in the cemetery.

Dialogue.Dialogue: These are Wolfe's footprints . . . It looks like he went into this pit here.
This is a sacred Mithiril Mine. Mithiril is also used in black magic . . .
It must be that mage!
This is no ordinary mage we are dealing with here. Stay alert. I'll lead. Aisha, take the rear.

Levels.AchievementText: Use at least 5 Forest cards in your Deck
Use at least 5 Tundra cards in your Deck

Dialogue.Dialogue: I never thought we'd get through that mine and find nothing . . .
Not even a trace of Wolfe . . . Is it possible we missed something inside?
It's possible. Aisha, did you notice anything?
. . . Aisha? I just saw her a minute ago . . .
WHAT?! It must be that mage! Let's go back. There must be something we missed inside!

Levels.AchievementText: Use an Earth rune in your deck.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Geez! How did we miss that crossroads the first time?
Congratulations. You've finally caught up to me!
Who are you? Where are my friends?
Hehe, I am Hadrian. You've been following me for some time now. As for your friends . . . don't worry, you'll be reunited with them soon enough.
It was you who started the war? What was the point of all this?
You'll have lots of time to figure it out while you're trapped in this dungeon with your friends.

Levels.AchievementText: At least 1 1-star cards in the Deck
Have fewer than 5 cards in the cemetery.

Dialogue.Dialogue: You're fast, I'll give you that. But you're not going to escape us so easily.
I'll admit, you're stronger than I predicted. But to think you could actually capture me . . . hahaha!
Finally I see it. How could I have been so stupid? This was your plan all along. You're working alongside the prince!
He knew the Swamp Tribe would leave, and the Emperor would be defeated, giving him control of Scarlet Nation.
He orchestrated this whole war just to become the Emperor!
Impressive . . . for a human . . . hahahaha . . .

Levels.AchievementText: Use an Air rune in your deck.
Use at least 6 Mountain cards in your deck

Dialogue.Dialogue: Finally finished him off. You guys alright?
I'm fine. I never would have thought that all this time, it was Prince Lionheart...
Captain, what should we do now?
We're going to find Prince Lionheart and hand him his arse!

Levels.AchievementText: At least 1 2-star cards in the Deck
Use a Water rune in your deck.

Dialogue.Dialogue: We should head back to the Black Swamp and look for him. If I have to guess, I'd say he's passing himself off as the Black Swamp Mage.
Look at these trees. The tops are filled with blue crystals.
This was a nesting ground for ancient Unicorns. The blue crystals are a source of their power.
But, no unicorns live around here anymore. The place has been overrun with Giant Molluscs.
And it looks like we've disturbed them…

Levels.AchievementText: Use at least 4 Mountain cards in your deck
Win with your Hero's HP at 70% or above.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Wow, look at the size of that oil patch! We should be able to provision up here.
The map shows this as being a lake...
Well, this used to be a lake, but a few years ago a massive earthquake struck and cause the oil underground to bubble up into the water.

Levels.AchievementText: At least 1 2-star cards in the Deck

Dialogue.Dialogue: on the map here it says, "Unicorn Waterfall."
Before the great earthquake, you would have seen thousands of Unicorns bathing here in the waterfall.
Captain, something is moving in the grass over there!
It's an ambush! Prepare yourselves!

Levels.AchievementText: Use a Fire rune in your deck.
Use at least 5 Swamp cards in your deck

Dialogue.Dialogue: Captain, these prisoners say Prince Lionheart is hiding out in a Haunted House at the top of the Black Swamp cliffs.
That cliff is massive! How are we supposed to get up there!?
10 years ago, we could have just ridden Unicorns to the top. Unfortunately, that’s no longer an option.
It looks like these prisoners rode Fire Drakes to get down.
Roar!
Are you sure these sparrows can carry us up there?
I don't think they're willing to cooperate...

Levels.AchievementText: Have fewer than 3 cards in the cemetery.
Use at least 4 Forest cards in your Deck

Dialogue.Dialogue: According to those prisoners, Prince Lionheart should be here.
That's right.
Let's split up and search for him.
No! You can't leave me here… alone!

Levels.AchievementText: Use at least 2 Tundra cards in your Deck.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Hahahaha! You saw through my plan. I guess you're not so simple minded after all.
Prince, it seems we had you all wrong from the start.
Go alert Wolfe!
Too late for that, now!

Levels.AchievementText: Have fewer than 4 cards in the cemetery.
Win with your Hero's HP at 60% or above.

Dialogue.Dialogue: He's escaped! Follow him!
He went this way! But, there is nothing here except a mirror...
Can you go through the mirror?
Stop!
Ah, how did you get over there?
Delivered right to us! We can't let you continue to tarnish this world!
He looks a little like me... But, you've got it all wrong. That man in the Royal outfit is the one you want, didn't you see him?
Enough talking! I'm going to put an end to you... once and for all!
What was that?
I remember there being a mirror in the Black Swamp Temple. One side reflects a person's righteous side, while the other reflects their dark side.
Hah! I wanted to give you a quick and painless death, but now I suppose I'll have to draw it out!
Captain, you talk an awful lot.
That's not me…
Everyone who gets in my way must be destroyed! Hahahaha! Enjoy your last moments!

Levels.AchievementText: At least 2 4-star cards in the Deck
Use an Air rune in your deck.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Prince Lionheart!
You two are really hard to deal with...
If I knew your plans earlier, I would have stopped you back on the plains!
You forced me into this...
What do you want!?
I want power!
No!
Quick, stop him!

Levels.AchievementText: Use at least 2 Swamp cards in your deck
At least 3 1-star cards in the Deck

Dialogue.Dialogue: There are just two of us here?
I can sense that there's someone else to the northwest...he is like us, who does not belong here.
Let's go find him.

Levels.AchievementText: Use at least 4 Swamp cards in your deck
At least 3 4-star cards in the Deck

Dialogue.Dialogue: What...where is this place? Why is it all purple here?
It seems the Prince has banished us into another space.
Is the Prince unstoppable now?!
Right now, we can't worry about that… what we should be worrying about is how to get out of here!

Levels.AchievementText: Win with your Hero's HP at 80% or above.

Dialogue.Dialogue: It does, indeed, look quite different than our world. The rocks and trees here are all purple… you look purple too, Leanda!
They just look purple.
In our world, our sight is influenced by magic, with reduced senses to the color purple. Here, we see things for they originally were.
However, I've never met such monsters before.

Levels.AchievementText: At least 1 3-star cards in the Deck

Dialogue.Dialogue: This tastes like dirt...
However, these monsters have a wonderful healing effect.
I wonder what happened to Aisha...
I shall use my teleknesis skill.
What now?
No...it won't work. This dimension has a different spacial composition than ours. I cannot sense anything.
However, I found a litter of monsters in the bush. They are waiting to attack us.
I am never going to eat this again.

Levels.AchievementText: At least 3 5-star cards in the Deck
Use a Fire rune in your deck.

Dialogue.Dialogue: This is the place...I feel he is nearby.
Who is there? A human and an elf? How did you arrive here?
We were sent here by Prince Lionheart. Who are you?!
Ah, you people. Are you here to convince the Black Swamp mages to retreat?
How do you know us?
I am Riore, the grand general of the Tribe.

Levels.AchievementText: Win with your Hero's HP at 80% or above.

Dialogue.Dialogue: General of the Tribe?

Yes. I was trapped here, and my leadership fell into the hand of the warmonger, Hadrian. Then, Hadrian and the Scarlet Nation invaded the northern lands. So, Archmage Loken asked you to counter attack the invasion force.
So...you know what is happening out there?
I have the Orb of Insight with me. It helps me know things. However, my black magic doesn't work in this dimension. I need your help.
Help me reach the Skeleton Tribe to the east, and acquire the Hand of Lambert. With it, we can leave this place.
You have to be very careful. The Hand of Lambert is protected by the Skeletal King. He is a tough creature.

Levels.AchievementText: Use at least 5 Forest cards in your Deck

Dialogue.Dialogue: I sense a powerful aura that is somewhere east of here. I bet the Hand of Lambert is somewhere around there.
Wait!
What?
I feel that this aura is familiar...it feels like the ancient seal near our swamp tribe...can you feel it?
No...forget it. Let's just find the hand.

Levels.AchievementText: Have fewer than 4 cards in the cemetery.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Look! That shining thing should be the Hand of Lambert.
Yes… I sense an aura similar to that of the ancient seal.
Wooo...a giant skeleton is waiting there. It may be the Skeletal King...
We can't beat it, even with Wolfe and Aisha here...
I have a place. Let me use my hypnosis spell and put it to sleep. Then, you guys can steal the hand.

Levels.AchievementText: Use at least 4 Tundra cards in your Deck

Dialogue.Dialogue: Wow...that was close.
You want to stare at it forever? I know you have questions. Let's go back to Riore and get some answers.
Alright. Let's go.

Levels.AchievementText: Use at least 4 Swamp cards in your deck

Dialogue.Dialogue: General, we have the Hand of Lambert.
Good job!
I have a question… When we were passing by the Red Wastelands, we found an ancient seal. What was that?
This space was used by our swamp mages to keep an ancient demon. Hadarian and Prince Lionheart released it for their own evil.
Uraaaaa!
No...the Skeletal King is coming.
You didn't kill it?
We just...put it to sleep.
Hold on! I'm summoning a portal for our escape!

Levels.AchievementText: Win with your Hero's HP at 80% or above.
Have fewer than 3 cards in the cemetery.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Are we going to rescue the Scarlet Nation right now?
No, we're going to take advantage of the Black Swamp's aggression. We plan to attack the Black Swamp now, while they are near defenseless.

No! Absolutely not! The Black Swamp's general is nothing but a fake. Prince Lionheart has used black magic to transform his own appearance to look like the general, meanwhile the true general is sealed in sub-space!
What?! Prince Lionheart isn't dead either? We all assumed he had died along with you...
Let's do as the general says, besiege the Black Swamp while they are besieging the Scarlet Nation.
It won't work. Prince Lionheart has a magical artifact. He can cast people into sub-space, which is exactly what just happened to me and Leanda.

It's the same artifact once used by the ancient Black Swamp mage's to seal the Demon. However Prince Lionheart has already broken that seal and released the demon back into our world. An Alliance with the Scarlet Nation is the only chance we have of
Alright, everybody listen up! We're going straight to the Scarlet Nation!

Levels.AchievementText: Have fewer than 4 cards in the cemetery.
Win with your Hero's HP at 80% or above.&Use at least 6 Mountain cards in your deck

Dialogue.Dialogue: I never thought we'd actually get out of there!
Where are we?
If I'm not mistaken, it looks like we're at the Sealed Lands.
Yeah, look at that circle!
Well, where should we go from here?!
First let's try to find Wolfe and Aisha.
Prince Lionheart is using his black magic to steal my appearance and control the Black Mage. I need to head home to take care of some things.
Your friends are most likely in the North. Go find them, quickly.

Levels.AchievementText: Use at least 5 Forest cards in your Deck
Use an Earth rune in your deck.&Have fewer than 3 cards in the cemetery.

Dialogue.Dialogue: We are going to the North? I've never been there before!
Look over there! Isn't that army from the Northern Alliance?
Isn't the war over? Don't tell me the Prince is at it again...
Hey! Isn't that Wolfe and Aisha at the front?
Let's go take a closer look.

Levels.AchievementText: At least 2 3-star cards in the Deck&Win with your Hero's HP at 80% or above.

Dialogue.Dialogue: It's you! I thought you were...
I know. It's a long story... Where are you going with so many men?
The Black Swamp Tribe has become war-crazed. After spending the last 2 years conquering every tribe within their vacinity they are now preparing to attack the Scarlet Nation.
Hold up a second...We've been gone for 2 years!?
Yeah. At first we were always sending out search parties to look for you, but over time we lost hope. Eventually we had to let Wolfe take over for you.
I'm sure we were only in Sub-space for 2 days… What? Wait… Did you just say that I've been replaced?
It's not as if you've been totally forgotten. You can be the General in charge of this expedition!

Levels.AchievementText: Use at least 6 Tundra cards in your Deck&Use at least 3 Swamp cards in your deck

Dialogue.Dialogue: We march today!
Sorry, I must request permission to set out on my own.
Leanda, where do you need to go so suddenly?
I'm afraid our current strength will not be anywhere near enough to face that Demon. I will head back to the Forest Kingdom and ask them to join us.
You think the Forest Kingdom will help us?
The outcome of this battle will affect everyone in the four kingdoms. The King is a noble man, he will not just sit by and watch as everyone else fights for life or death.
Thank you, Leanda. We'll all be relying on you.
We'll see each other again soon.

Levels.AchievementText: Use a Water rune in your deck.
Emerge victorious before completing 28 Rounds.&Have fewer than 4 cards in the cemetery.

Dialogue.Dialogue: General, We've almost arrived at the Scarlet Nation.
Our scout has reported large numbers of the Black Swamp tribe stationed up ahead.
Occupied so quickly? I never imagined the Scarlet Nation would have been so vulnerable.
The Scarlet Nation was decimated after the war, and with the Black Swamp's strength increased through annexing of all the surrounding tribes... I expected nothing less.
No matter the odds, we must try to help free the Scarlet Nation.

Levels.AchievementText: Use at least 6 Swamp cards in your deck
Use at least 6 Mountain cards in your deck&No runes.

Dialogue.Dialogue: I never would have expected the Black Swamp Tribe toalready be attacking the Nation's Capital!
Listen. What is that?
An earthquake?
No! Look over there!
Whoa...
A huge... Is it coming this way!?
Retreat! In to the city, close the gates! Now!!

Levels.AchievementText: At least 3 4-star cards in the Deck
Eliminate all of the cards.&Use at least 6 Forest cards in your Deck

Dialogue.Dialogue: Rrrroooaarr...
General, Leanda has safely returned with the Forest Kingdom, however that Demon has already reached the Dragon Scale Pass!
General, I've read about this monster before. It's body releases a toxic gas that will put any and all creatures near it it into a state of unconsciousness. Whatever you do, do not go near it!
Is there any way to defend against it?
The only known defense is to wear Armor made of Fire vines from the far east. But it's much too late to collect those now.
The River of Lava is near Dragon Scale Pass. Maybe we could draw the demons attention and get him to run straight into the river, that will slow him down.
Good idea. Can you lead the team?

Levels.AchievementText: Win with your Hero's HP at 90% or above.&Emerge victorious before completing 28 Rounds.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Excellent work!
Look at that Demon, looks so weird.
Huh...
Look, It looks like he's attacking that Black Mage.
The lava must have destroyed the artifact they were using to control it.
We need to figure something out quick, before all 4 of our Kingdoms are destroyed!
Our elf priests have spells that can accelerate plant growth. Maybe they could grow Vines to entangle and trap the Demon.
We need time to complete our spell. You must hold him off to buy us some time.

Levels.AchievementText: At least 3 4-star cards in the Deck
Emerge victorious before completing 28 Rounds.&At least 2 3-star cards in the Deck

Dialogue.Dialogue: Success!
Though this this is not going to hold up forever.
The priests cannot continue chanting their mantra's without a break. As soon as the mantra's are broken, the demon will be able to break free.
This Demon can't be killed.
That voice… Arch mage Loken!
You guys keep holding him here… Some men will be coming by to help seal him again shortly.
Until then, everyone's safety relies on you.
People will be coming by to seal him… Then, the magic artifact has already been found?!
Look! The Black Swamp Tribe is already advancing on him! And so is the Scarlet Nation!
Northern Alliance, let's move!
The Forest Kingdom marches as one with the North!
With all four kingdoms fighting together, there is no way we can lose!

Levels.AchievementText: At least 3 1-star cards in the Deck
Eliminate all of the cards.&No runes.
Have fewer than 3 cards in the cemetery.
Emerge victorious before completing 24 Rounds.&Deck must include at least 1 card from each class.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Is it all over now?
I think so, I can't sense him anymore.
I can't believe it was Riore that came to cast the seal.
Yeah, he said his magical abilities came back to him after he got out of sub-space.
Let's take advantage of this victory and force all of these black mages back to return to the Black Swamp.
Look, they are retreating!
The spell that demon was using to control them must have been broken once he was sealed away.
Well, it looks like our work here is done. Let's head back to the north.

Levels.AchievementText: Have fewer than 2 cards in the cemetery.
No runes.&Eliminate all of the cards.

Dialogue.Dialogue: General, are you positive Prince Lionheart is still alive?
Of course, he was using some form of magic of disguise to appear as Riore to control the Black Swamp.
Probably for a few years.
As long as he is still out there our 4 kingdoms may never be at ease.
That is why I plan on heading back to the Black Swamp to deal with him once and for all.

Levels.AchievementText: Use at least 5 Mountain cards in your deck
Eliminate all of the cards.&Can only use 5 star cards in your deck.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Quick, come look at this! Why are there so many giant statues?
Something makes me feel like I read about these statues in a text book back at the Augur Academy.
Stand back! I have a bad feeling about this…
I remember! We've just stumbled upon the Black Swamp's stone forest. We need to get out of here, and fast!
Crack~
Look! The Statues are moving!

Levels.AchievementText: Have fewer than 5 cards in the cemetery.
Use at least 4 Mountain cards in your deck&Kill the opponent's Hero.

Dialogue.Dialogue: What are these things? There are terrifying!
These statues were all once traitors to the Black Swamp Tribe. For their treason, they were all turned to stone and placed here.
They all must have died here.
Well, none of this matters anyway. We must continue on.
If we continue on down this path we'll eventually get to the Black Swamp's Capital city.

Levels.AchievementText: Use at least 2 Mountain cards in your deck&No runes.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Stop! The Capital city is up ahead, foreigners are not permitted to enter the city.
Hey, do they look familiar to you?
Now that you mention it, I may have seen a wanted poster with 4 people that looked like them!
We have been ordered by the Kingdom to catch and turn in these criminal. Dead or alive!!!

Levels.AchievementText: Deck COST can not be higher than 140
Have fewer than 5 cards in the cemetery.&Use a Fire rune in your deck.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Wow, those guards were really pathetic.
If there is a warrant out for our arrest, does that mean Prince Lionheart is still controlling the Black Swamp?
Yes, we must find him as quick as we can. We need to stop him from disrupting the peace.

Levels.AchievementText: At least 1 4-star cards in the Deck&Eliminate all of the cards.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Long time no see!
Prince Lionheart
He's going to be tough to deal with, everyone join in!
Listen to me first, I'm the real…

Levels.AchievementText: Use a Water rune in your deck.
Can't have more than 9 cards in your deck.&Can only use 5 star cards in your deck.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Wait! WAIT!! I think we're fighting the wrong person. He really is the real Riore.
I really never imagined in my own homeland I'd be wanted for arrest. And now this to be attacked by my own comrades.
Arch Mage, do you know where Prince Lionheart is?
My best guess, he is sitting on my throne taking an afternoon nap.
Let's go find him and finish this!
My thoughts exactly!

Levels.AchievementText: Have fewer than 5 cards in the cemetery.
No runes.&Use at least 6 Mountain cards in your deck

Dialogue.Dialogue: Hahaha! I heard a funny joke. So 3 humans, 1 elf and a man disguised as me walk into a room...
Hold on to him as long as you can. I can break the magic of disguise spell but I'll need some time.
You useless pieces of garbage, why are you just standing there! Attack!
Your wish is my command!

Levels.AchievementText: Use an Earth rune in your deck.
Use at least 2 Tundra cards in your Deck.&Use at least 5 Mountain cards in your deck

Dialogue.Dialogue: Success!
Isn't that the Scarlet Nation's Prince Lionheart?
Everyone, please listen to me. I am the true Riore! Prince Lionheart has been using a magic of disguise to impersonate me.
Hahaha! You've finally found me out! Once heir to the Scarlet Nations Throne, later the ruler of the Black Swamp Tribe. Hahaha!
I must be the only person to have ruled over 2 of our 4 great nations!
Let's see how you escape from us this time Lionheart!
Attention all soldiers! Capture this lying impersonator and bring him to me!

DialogueAfter.Dialogue: Ahh? Lionheart rescued by a black smoke bomb!
Well, I guess that was more than just a novelty item.
Arch Mage, a confidential letter from the King has just arrived for you.
The Alliance is in trouble. The Scarlet Nation has attacked the North's western front. We must return to the north immediately!
Then we have no time to waste, let's go!
The fastest way to the North would be the Path of Oblivion. But there is no record of anyone ever making it off that path alive…
I'm sure we'll be fine. We have no time to waste!

Levels.AchievementText: At least 1 3-star cards in the Deck&Use at least 3 Tundra cards in your Deck
Have fewer than 5 cards in the cemetery.
Use a Fire rune in your deck.&Kill the opponent's Hero.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Hey! Look here!
What's up, Aisha?
There are some recent traces of fighting. I'm sure General has been here.
Indeed, we may find General along these traces.
I don't think it will go that smooth. Just look at there.
Yeah...I see. Ready for battle!

Levels.AchievementText: At least 1 5-star cards in the Deck
Use at least 3 Swamp cards in your deck&Emerge victorious before completing 24 Rounds.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Ah! Look at the skeleton on the ground. Has someone already been here?
Seems like previous adventures, maybe a century ago.
Mortal! I shall freeze your souls and devour your fear!
Who the hell are you?
Ah...it...it is...
What? You know who it is?
No chatting! He is coming! Arms up!

DialogueAfter.Dialogue: Oh...that was really close! By the way, what were you trying to say, Wolfe?
I've known something about him before, from Arctic History. His name is Dread Lord, who feeds on people's fear and is extremely bloodthirsty...really dangerous.
I see...luckily we're quite near now. Just after the cliff ahead is the boundary, let's move!

Levels.AchievementText: Can not use any card that is in your opponents deck.
Can't have more than 8 cards in your deck.&Can only use 5 star cards in your deck.

Dialogue.Dialogue: General, we need to be careful. This path is full of danger.
Time is not on our side. Let's hurry to Blizzard Fortress.
I agree.
General, Black Swamp chasers are behind us!
They must be ordered by Prince Lionheart. Warriors, assemble!
Driving them away would be enough. Don't waste too much time on them.
Roger that.

Levels.AchievementText: Use an Earth rune in your deck.
Use at least 2 Tundra cards in your Deck.&Emerge victorious before completing 32 Rounds.

Dialogue.Dialogue: It takes much longer than I thought. I feel so tired now.
Deal with it. This is the shortest way to Blizzard Fortress.
I agree. The boundary must be in critical condition now. There's no time to waste.
Yes, General.
Look ahead, I'm afraid we have some other companies.
Oh...great. I'm not prepared yet.

Levels.AchievementText: At least 3 5-star cards in the Deck
Use at least 5 Mountain cards in your deck&Use a Water rune in your deck.

Dialogue.Dialogue: General, these creatures look really hostile against us.
Apparently they have regarded us as invaders. Let's keep moving!
This place is so chilling. I'm afraid my nerves will be on the edge if I stay here any longer.
In my opinion, there is something fishy that Scarlet Empire attacked us, as if...
Be careful!
Who are you!

Levels.AchievementText: Can only use 5 star cards in your deck.
Can not use 2 of the same cards in your deck.&Can not use any card that is in your opponents deck.

Dialogue.Dialogue: General! Are you OK?
I'm fine. Where are we now?
We get separated with general because of the blizzard summoned by the mysterious man.
Damn! We need to find him as soon as possible!
Look, is there a man ahead? Maybe we could ask him?
I'd rather not. I don't think that man has his sanity.
It never hurts to take a try.

Levels.AchievementText: Use an Air rune in your deck.
At least 1 4-star cards in the Deck&Use at least 4 Forest cards in your Deck

Dialogue.Dialogue: Damn it! Why are we deserved to meet this mess? Are we never to find the general again and trapped here forever?
Wolfe! I believe general is looking for us, too! Just don't give up!
You're right. It's too early to give up. Let's go and find him!
Roger that, general.
Hey look, those guys are going to catch up with us again! Let's go now!
It's too late! Ready for battle!

Levels.AchievementText: Use at least 3 Mountain cards in your deck&Emerge victorious before completing 32 Rounds.

Dialogue.Dialogue: General!
Oh? It's you! Great! We've been searching for you!
We had some situation but we finally made it, general.
What's the situation here, general?
It's OK. We've encountered some monsters and defeated them. However, another group is still fighting. They're not far from us.
Let's reinforce them before it's too late.
Ok, let's go!

Levels.AchievementText: Use a Water rune in your deck.
No runes.&Emerge victorious before completing 32 Rounds.

Dialogue.Dialogue: Why this place makes me so upset? As if even time were frozen here.
Something seems really weird here.
Let's go! Hurry! I'll never come here again in the rest of my life.
No, you won't, because all of you will die here now.
Who are you?
Get out of our way! We don't want unnecessary fight here!
Seems they don't want to retreat. Prepare for battle!

Levels.AchievementText: Can't have more than 7 cards in your deck.&Use at least 5 Swamp cards in your deck

Dialogue.Dialogue: Oh no! There he comes again!
How stubborn! He just doesn't give up.
Well, he leaves us no alternative but to crush him. Prepare for battle!

Levels.AchievementText: At least 1 4-star cards in the Deck
No runes.&Use at least 5 Forest cards in your Deck
No runes.&Win with your Hero's HP at 60% or above.
